WorkItem.ClosedComment: Thanks for logging this issue. We've moved to a new codebase on GitHub; please try your issue against the new compiler (once it's possible) and log an issue on the GitHub site if it still reproduces
WorkItem.Description:
[1,,] is equivalent to [1,undefined] in JavaScript. TypeScript converts it to [1, ], which JavaScript would read as [1].

This is an easy way to put 'undefined' in an array, but TypeScript blocks it. TS should rather output [1, undefined], or just [1, , ].

Comments.Message: Thanks for the report, marked as active.
